summary: The bill, titled the Protecting Taxpayer Resources Act, requires the Treasury Inspector General for Tax Administration to make a determination before any Department of Homeland Security function is imposed on Internal Revenue Service personnel. This determination must confirm that personnel are adequately trained and that the added duties won't negatively impact the IRS's ability to provide taxpayer service and enforce tax laws fairly. The determination must be published in the Federal Register.  The bill also makes a conforming amendment to the Homeland Security Act of 2002.
